summary: The sort script handles sorting on any collection
of elements. All you have to do is specify the attributes.
You start by adding the js-sort-container attribute to wrap the rest.
Inside of the container you got your js-sort-button with a unique id,
js-sort-data-container which contains js-sort-sortables and js-sort-data.
Each button will need a unique id. The data to be affected by a button need to have the same id.
In the example above each element is both a sortable and also data.<br>

description.js-sort-order: In what order to sort data
description.js-sort-button: The button to click for sort
description.js-sort-data-container: The container where the sortables will be appended
